main
Class MonomSet

java.lang.Object
  main.MonomSet

public class MonomSet
extends java.lang.Object

We first implement the Set of monoms. These sets are the big(!) sets which constist of all monoms matching some certain type. Thus the monoms are ordered only by their signature, not by their number of ones yet.
For example the set of X-X-XX contains:
0-0-00
0-1-00
0-1-10
1-0-01
1-1-11

The sorting of the subsets is delegate to another class, which is not yet defined : ToDo!!!
The finer sorting class gets an object of this class as a parameter

Author:
chrissy

Constructor Detail

MonomSet

public MonomSet(java.lang.String signature)
Parameters:
signature - only monoms of this signature are really added to the set.
Method Detail

add

public int add(Monom m)
Parameters:
m - monom to add to the list
Returns:
integer which describes the sucess of the method:
i == 1 iff signature is correct and the monom doesnt belong to the list and it is added by the method
i == 2 iff signature is correct but the monom is already in the list
i == 3 iff the signature is not correct

remove

public int remove(Monom m)
Parameters:
m - monom to be removed from the list.
Returns:
integer which describes the sucess of the method:
i == 1 iff signature the monom was in the list and is now removed
i == 2 iff signature is correct but the monom wasnt in the list
i == 3 iff the signature is not correct

getSignature

public java.lang.String getSignature()
Returns:
the signature of this monomset

getIterator

public java.util.Iterator getIterator()
Returns:
an iterator to walk through the monom list
